title: Abnormal controller commands detected
situation: Engineering workstation shows unexpected write attempts to a substation controller outside change window.
expected: Treat as potential cyber incident, notify Incident Commander, and shift to containment-ready posture.
why: Unauthorized commands can alter protection schemes and risk safety. Early containment prevents cascading impacts.

roleVariants.ot-operator: Capture screenshots, block local changes, and contact the Incident Commander immediately.
roleVariants.system-admin: Check change calendar, collect logs from the workstation, and prepare to isolate the source if authorized.
roleVariants.security-team: Validate command origin, pull endpoint telemetry, and advise on segmentation controls.
roleVariants.compliance-audit: Document the timeline and confirm whether the activity meets reportable criteria.
roleVariants.other-staff: Do not touch the workstation; call ECS or the Incident Commander at once.
roleVariants.default: Escalate, preserve evidence, and await containment direction.

title: Malware alert on historian server
situation: Security monitoring flags a known OT-targeting malware signature on the historian server.
expected: Move to high severity, coordinate containment, and prepare recovery from clean backups.
why: Historians bridge operations and analytics; compromise can spread or corrupt data.

roleVariants.ot-operator: Notify that historian data may be stale; rely on primary controls and log manual readings if needed.
roleVariants.system-admin: Preserve memory and disk artifacts, then isolate the server per approval.
roleVariants.security-team: Lead forensics, confirm signature validity, and propose eradication steps.
roleVariants.compliance-audit: Ensure evidence is retained and reporting timers are tracked once severity is set.
roleVariants.other-staff: Avoid accessing historian dashboards until cleared; follow updates.
roleVariants.default: Support containment and maintain evidence integrity.

title: Phishing leads to credential misuse
situation: User reports a convincing phishing email; shortly after, unusual VPN logins appear from new geography.
expected: Disable affected credentials, validate scope, and check for lateral movement.
why: Credentials can provide direct access to OT management systems; fast action reduces blast radius.

roleVariants.ot-operator: Confirm if any control system access was attempted; report anomalies immediately.
roleVariants.system-admin: Disable accounts, force password resets, and review access logs for privileged systems.
roleVariants.security-team: Correlate VPN, AD, and OT access logs; recommend containment and monitoring rules.
roleVariants.compliance-audit: Track whether reportable thresholds are met and log decision times.
roleVariants.other-staff: Forward the phishing email headers to ECS and stop using the account until cleared.
roleVariants.default: Secure the account, investigate scope, and document actions.

title: Vendor remote support channel abused
situation: Unexpected remote session established on an OT server via vendor support tool outside approved hours.
expected: Treat as high severity until validated, suspend the session, and contact vendor through official channel.
why: Unauthorized remote access can bypass standard controls and introduce changes or malware.

roleVariants.ot-operator: Alert operations leadership and note any control anomalies during the window.
roleVariants.system-admin: Terminate unapproved sessions if authorized, preserve session logs, and rotate credentials if needed.
roleVariants.security-team: Validate remote host identity, gather telemetry, and guide containment with Incident Commander.
roleVariants.compliance-audit: Record vendor contacts, approvals, and whether notification obligations were triggered.
roleVariants.other-staff: Do not engage the remote user; notify ECS/Incident Commander immediately.
roleVariants.default: Pause access, validate authorization, and document all actions.
